message: Undid revision 466396947 by [[Special:Contributions/Fifelfoo|Fifelfoo]] ([[User talk:Fifelfoo|talk]])-This revision restores balance. Further removal will prove inappropriate bias & transfer this issue out of Wikipedia for public debate on internet

The editing of this article by Fifelfoo has produced an appearance of strong bias towards the controversial views of Peter Stanleyand removed any semblance of balance. Lack of balance could heve damaged the standing of Wikipedia for impartiality.

Undid revision 464725299 by [[Special:Contributions/Nick-D|Nick-D]] ([[User talk:Nick-D|talk]]). The additional sentence is a matter of public record; it does not need a citation and removes an appearance of lack of impartiality in Wikipedia by an ad

The shortened addition is a matter of common knowledge and should not need citation. Dr Stanley introduced his involvement in this matter of public controversy in the text. This sentence is therefore a relevant addition.
The addition completes the reference to the Battle for Australia which had been left hanging in mid air
The editing by Fifelfoo has removed all balance from this article. The two sentences that he left are irrelevant and should be removed so as to leave only Peter Stanley's views.

James Bowen graduated in history and politics from Queensland University in 1955; specialised in Japanese history from Kamakura Shogunate to end of the Pacific War; recognised as qualified Pacific War historian by Australian Government

Undid revision 466482763 by [[Special:Contributions/Fifelfoo|Fifelfoo]] ([[User talk:Fifelfoo|talk]]) Will admin pls advise Fifelfoo that his editing is damaging Wikipedia's reputation for impartiality and balance in articles
